javadoc:
A generic reusable panel for selecting a language.
 Also, supports a filter to limit languages that are displayed.

methods.javadoc:
Constructs a new panel.
@param service the language service to use to retrieve the languages
methods.name: <init>

params.name: service
params.comment: the language service to use to retrieve the languages

methods.javadoc:
Allows language versions to appear appended to name
@param enable
methods.name: setShowVersion
methods.comment: Allows language versions to appear appended to name

methods.javadoc:
Selects the language with the specified language ID.
@param languageID the ID of language to select
methods.name: setSelectedLanguage
methods.comment: Selects the language with the specified language ID.

params.name: languageID
params.comment: the ID of language to select

methods.javadoc:
Update the panel. Requests a new list of languages from the
 language service and updates the table.
methods.name: update
methods.comment:
Update the panel. Requests a new list of languages from the
 language service and updates the table.

methods.javadoc:
Returns the selected language, or null if no language is selected.
@return the selected language, or null if no language is selected.
methods.name: getSelectedLanguage
methods.comment: Returns the selected language, or null if no language is selected.

return.comment: the selected language, or null if no language is selected.

methods.name: setFilter

return.comment: the number of languages that matched the filter

methods.javadoc:
Select the highest priority language being displayed.
 If more than one language has the highest priority, then the first
 one will be used.
methods.name: selectHighestPriorityLanguage
methods.comment:
Select the highest priority language being displayed.
 If more than one language has the highest priority, then the first
 one will be used.

name: SelectLanguagePanel
comment:
A generic reusable panel for selecting a language.
 Also, supports a filter to limit languages that are displayed.
